Package uk.rib.armouryoftheguardian

Class Weapon

  • java.lang.Object
    • uk.rib.armouryoftheguardian.Weapon
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    android.os.Parcelable
    public class Weapon
extends java.lang.Object
implements android.os.Parcelable
    This is for the weapon screen and gets the end user's selected weapon's name, picture, definition, statistics, and potential perks.

    Parcelable is used, and is an interface for class instances that can be written to, and restored from, a Parcel. For classes implementing the Parcelable interface, they must also have a non-null static field called CREATOR of a type that implements the Parcelable.Creator interface.

    Since:
    22.3

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from interface android.os.Parcelable

      Modifier Constructor Description
      protected Weapon​(android.os.Parcel parcel)
      This gets all weapon info from the parcel, which includes: The definition of the weapon The weapon's weapon_image_icon The weapon's statistics, like its damage, range, stability, and so forth The perks the weapon can use
        Weapon​(com.google.gson.JsonObject weaponDefinition, android.graphics.Bitmap weaponIcon)
      This defines the end user's selected weapon's image and description from the JsonObject and Bitmap of the weapon.

    • Field Detail

      • CREATOR

        public static final android.os.Parcelable.Creator<Weapon> CREATOR
        This returns a new weapon.

        'createFromParcel' is used to create a new instance of the Parcelable class (which Weapon implements) and then instantiating it from the supplied Parcel whose data had previously been written by Parcelable.writeToParcel.

        Since:
        22.3

        22.3

      • Weapon

        @RequiresApi(api=29)
protected Weapon​(android.os.Parcel parcel)
        This gets all weapon info from the parcel, which includes:
        • The definition of the weapon
        • The weapon's weapon_image_icon
        • The weapon's statistics, like its damage, range, stability, and so forth
        • The perks the weapon can use
        Parameters:
        parcel - The Parcel being read for information on the weapon.
        Since:
        22.3

      • writeToParcel

        @RequiresApi(api=29)
public void writeToParcel​(android.os.Parcel dest,
                          int flags)
        This flattens the end user's selected weapon's information in to a Parcel.
        Specified by:
        writeToParcel in interface android.os.Parcelable
        Parameters:
        dest - The Parcel in which the object should be written. This value cannot be null.
        flags - Additional flags about how the object should be written. May be 0 or PARCELABLE_WRITE_RETURN_VALUE.
